name: Simplex 7 - Game Set 3
description:
Simple 7 - Game Set 3

This game has been designed to look really easy to solve, yet once the player starts trying to solve a specific game level it may be harder than originally thought. The game gets more difficult after Game 5 when the difficulty level increases steadily. 

Objective - Moves: To see how few moves it takes a player to solve a specific game.  As the game is repeated by the player, the objective is to try to reduce the amount of moves required, to the least number of moves possible to complete. 

Timer: There is a timer that has been built into the game for players that would like to compete against the clock. Simply double click on the center of the rotatable disc to start the timer. Once the game is completed and the "Well Done!" message appears, double click on the center disc again to stop the timer. (This feature is not started automatically.)

The game is part of the complete Strategy Seven game that is being developed for mobile game play.  The game was originally designed in 1993. A physical board game was produced in 2007. Find out more about the game on the "ABOUT" page on the home screen.
